page.title: 10Farmland
page.content: 1. Crops other than grass There is very little cultivation of this kind in the area. Three hill farms NW of Sampford Spiney grow some cereal. To the west there is a barn, converted into Coomhill Cottage with 12 acres of which 4 acres are sugar beet and 3 acres are potatoes. One or two crops of kale are grown. 2. Intensively managed grassland Gee's Eastontown, Sampford Spiney ploughs and reseeds for grass. At Merrivale Farm several fields are laid down for hay. 3. Enclosed Rough Grazing Practically allthe farmland falls into this category. The enclosures, originally traditional stone walls, are often dilapidated and have been supplemented with barabed wire fencing, much of which is not stock-proof.
